channel.title: Java Image Detection
channel.description:
First of all, this isnt for runescape so dont flame me. I need a way to take a bitmap, find it on screen and do something such as click it.
Is java the best program for this? I am trying to avoid using 3rd party programs like SCAR.
What is the the best way to do this in java, is there a findbitmap type of thing in it?
Sorry if this is noobish I'll close it if its against rules or anything. Thanks.

item.title: Java Image Detection
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

io9:

Yeah, get the canvas object and get it’s paint() method to paint to one of your own Bufferedmage object and get da pixels from der.

belbn:

First of all, this isnt for runescape

Read full topic

item.title: Java Image Detection
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:2, topic:216284”]I can’t help you, and the others’ll probably redirect you to google, so… did you even google? So… clicky![/quote]in future, dont fucking post

no, java is not the best language to use. you should use a language that has [easy] access to the windows API, depending on your experience, this may be C++, C# or even VB

Read full topic
